name: C. Strange Function
statement:
Let f(i) denote the minimum positive integer x such that x is a divisor
of i.Compute
sum_{i=1}^n f(i) modulo 10^9+7. In other words, compute f(1)+f(2)+
dots+f(n) modulo 10^9+7.
editorial:
Enumerate the value of f(i)
. Since f(n)=i
 means lcm(1,2,...,i?1)?n
, f(n)
 will not be too big (less than 100
). The number of k
s such that f(k)=i
 is ?n/lcm(1,2,...,i?1)???n/lcm(1,2,...,i)?
. (k
 should be divisible by 1?i?1
 but not i
) So the answer is ?i>1i(?n/lcm(1,2,...,i?1)???n/lcm(1,2,...,i)?)
.

We can also write the answer in another form, which is equivalent to the previous form:

?i?1?n/lcm(1,2,...,i)?+n
